question_content.barrons:question: According to the passage, all of the following were true of the center of an atom EXCEPT that it

barrons:choices.barrons:choice: had not yet been seen by the naked eye
was very little larger than a molecule
was smaller than 1/125 millionth of an inch

question_content.barrons:explanation:
was very little larger than a molecule.

The passage states that molecules are made of atoms; logically, therefore, an atom is smaller, not larger, than the molecule to which it belongs.

Had not yet been seen by the naked eye is incorrect. This passage states atoms have never been seen or photographed.

Contained elements that were positively charged is incorrect. This passage mentions the presence of positive electrical elements.

Followed experimentally determinable processes is incorrect. This passage notes the ingenious laboratory experiments that determine its operations or processes.

Was smaller than 1/125 millionth of an inch is incorrect. This passage mentions the average diameter of a molecule is 1/125 millionth of an inch. Atoms are smaller yet.
